sn46.76:4.1: “Mendicants, when the perception of cessation is developed and cultivated it’s very fruitful and beneficial. …”
sn46.76:4.3: It’s when a mendicant develops the perception of cessation together with the awakening-factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, samādhi, and
sn46.76:4.4: equanimity, which rely on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripen as letting go.
sn46.76:4.5: That’s how, when the perception of cessation is developed and cultivated, it’s very fruitful and beneficial. …”
sn46.76:5.1: “When the perception of cessation is developed and cultivated you can expect one of two results:
sn46.76:5.2: final knowledge in the present life, or if there’s something left over, non-return.
sn46.76:5.5: It’s when a mendicant develops the perception of cessation together with the awakening-factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, samādhi, and
sn46.76:5.6: equanimity, which rely on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripen as letting go.
sn46.76:5.7: When the perception of cessation is developed and cultivated in this way you can expect one of two results:
sn46.76:5.8: final knowledge in the present life, or if there’s something left over, non-return.”
sn46.76:6.1: “The perception of cessation, when developed and cultivated, leads to great benefit … great sanctuary … great inspiration … great ease.
sn46.76:6.3: It’s when a mendicant develops the perception of cessation together with the awakening-factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, samādhi, and
sn46.76:6.4: equanimity, which rely on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripen as letting go.
sn46.76:6.5: That’s how the perception of cessation, when developed and cultivated, leads to great benefit … great sanctuary … great inspiration … great ease.”
